radiographic_examinations.findings: The visualized lung bases are clear. There is no pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver is normal in attenuation with mild periportal edema. The portal and hepatic veins are patent. The gallbladder is normal with no stones. The pancreas is normal in attenuation. The spleen is unremarkable. The adrenal glands are normal bilaterally. The kidneys enhance and excrete contrast normally. The stomach and small bowel are normal in caliber. In the right lower quadrant, there is a fluid dilated, hyperemic structure measuring up to 1.1 cm representing the appendix. There is no evidence of abscess formation. The large bowel is normal in caliber. No mesenteric lymphadenopathy, free air, or free fluid. Urinary bladder, prostate, and seminal vesicles are unremarkable. There is no pelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid. The aorta is normal in caliber and its major branches are patent. The bones are normal in appearance.
